relation: Form element name. For example, 1 equals F01 and 2 equals F02. Typically the p_idx parameter is constant for a given column.
Current value. This value should be a value in the p_list_values parameter.
Text name of a flow list of values. This list of values must be defined in your flow. This parameter is used only by the select_list_from_lov function.
Extra HTML parameters you wish to add.
Extra select option to enable the NULL selection. Range of values is YES and NO.
Value to be returned when a user selects the null option. Only relevant when p_show_null equals YES.
Value to be displayed when a user selects the null option. Only relevant when p_show_null equals YES.
textBeforeTable: Table 13-21 SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV Parameters Table 13-21 describes the parameters available in the SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV function. Parameters RETURN VARCHAR2; p_null_text IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT) p_null_value IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_show_null IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_attributes IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_lov IN VARCHAR2, p_value IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_idx IN NUMBER, HTMLDB_ITEM.SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV(  Syntax  This function dynamically generates select lists from a shared list of values (LOV). Similar to other functions available in the HTMLDB_ITEM package, these select list functions are designed to generate forms with F01 to F50 form array elements. SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV Function     FROM emp SELECT HTMLDB_ITEM.SELECT_LIST(1,'Y','Yes;Y,No;N') The following example demonstrates a static select list that displays Yes, returns Y, defaults to Y, and generates a F01 form item.  Example  Value to be returned when a user selects the null option. Only relevant when P_SHOW_NULL equals YES. p_null_value Extra select option to enable the NULL selection. Range of values is YES and NO. p_show_null Extra HTML parameters you wish to add. p_attributes List of static values separated
textAfterTable: Example The following demonstrates a select list based on a LOV defined in the application. SELECT HTMLDB_ITEM.SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV(2,job,'JOB_FLOW_LOV') FROM emp SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV_XL Function This function dynamically generates very large select lists (greater than 32K) from a shared list of values (LOV). Similar to other functions available in the HTMLDB_ITEM package, these select list functions are designed to generate forms with F01 to F50 form array elements. Syntax HTMLDB_ITEM.SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV_XL( p_idx IN NUMBER, p_value IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_lov IN VARCHAR2, p_attributes IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_show_null IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_null_value IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT, p_null_text IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT) RETURN CLOB; Parameters Table 13-22 describes the parameters available in the SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV_XL function. Table 13-22 SELECT_LIST_FROM_LOV_XL Parameters Parameter Description p_idx Form element name. For example, 1 equals F01 and 2 equals F02. Typically the p_idx parameter is constant for a given column. p_value Current value.
